intro: Chalcas paniculata var. zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's chalcas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or disturbed areas.
